required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pain After Insufflation for Robotic Sacrocolpopexy (PAIRS) Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Pain After Insufflation for Robotic Sacrocolpopexy (PAIRS) Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates post-operative pain between different insufflation pressures during robotic-assisted sacrocolpopexy. Subjective pain and narcotic usage after surgery will be measured.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a prospective single-blind randomized controlled trial of adult women undergoing robotic-assisted sacrocolpopexy for pelvic organ prolapse. Each surgery will be performed by a board-certified Female Pelvic Medicine & Reconstructive Surgery (FPMRS) surgeon with a standard technique other than pneumoperitoneum level. A sacrocolpopexy for apical prolapse may be performed at the same time as a hysterectomy and other clinically indicated procedures if desired by the patient and as part of the standard of care. Patients will be stratified by hysterectomy prior to randomization. Postoperatively, patients will be evaluated with a Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) as well as prescribed narcotic analgesic use and followed up to 2 weeks.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Patients will be randomized to receive either standard pneumoperitoneum (15 mmHg) versus a lower level of pneumoperitoneum (12 mmHg).
study_design_info.masking_description: Patients will be unaware of their study group status and unaware of level of pneumoperitoneum used during their surgical procedure.

primary_outcome.measure: Post-operative Pain on a visual analogue scale, ranging from 1-10 with a higher score meaning more pain.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pain will be assessed within 24 hours of the surgery. .
primary_outcome.description: Pain will be assessed during the 24-hour post-operative period.

primary_outcome.measure: Post-operative Pain on a visual analogue scale, ranging from 1-10 with a higher score meaning more pain.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pain will be assessed at the two-week post-operative follow-up visit.
primary_outcome.description: Pain will be assessed during the two-week post-operative period.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety using Operation length, blood loss, need to increase insufflation, operative conversion rates. These are all counts with higher numbers meaning worse outcomes.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Safety will be assessed during the procedure.
primary_outcome.description: The safety of the lower insufflation pressure will be assessed during the procedure.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety using Operation length, blood loss, need to increase insufflation, operative conversion rates. These are all counts with higher numbers meaning worse outcomes.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Safety will be assessed immediately post-operatively.
primary_outcome.description: The safety of the lower insufflation pressure will be assessed immediately post-operatively.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety using Operation length, blood loss, need to increase insufflation, operative conversion rates. These are all counts with higher numbers meaning worse outcomes.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Safety will be assessed at the two-week follow-up visit.
primary_outcome.description: The safety of the lower insufflation pressure will be assessed at the two-week follow-up visit.

arm_group.description: Patients will receive standard insufflation during surgery (15 mm Hg).
Patients will receive a lower level of insufflation during surgery (12 mm Hg or lower).

intervention.description: This is the amount of insufflation using during the surgical procedure.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Scheduled to have a robotic-assisted sacrocolpopexy surgery for pelvic organ prolapse.
- Age 18-90 years
- Can read and understand the consent form and consents to the procedure
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing other procedures
- Patients who do not consent to participate.

eligibility.gender_description: This procedure only applies to women.
